speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about when you first noticed the rapid breathing, was it sudden or did it come on gradually? How old are you, by the way?

speaker: Patient
text: I'm 3! Mommy said I started breathing funny a few days ago, and it's been like that ever since. Sometimes I feel like I need to catch my breath, and my legs feel puffy, especially when I wake up in the morning.

speaker: Doctor
text: That must be very uncomfortable for you. Can you tell me more about the puffiness in your legs, does it go away as the day goes on or does it stay the same? Have you had any fever or cough recently?

speaker: Patient
text: Mommy says my legs feel better when I walk around and play, but they still look a little fat. And no, I don't have a cough, and Mommy took my temperature and it was normal, she said. Sometimes I don't want to eat, like my favorite goldfish crackers, and that's not like me.

speaker: Doctor
text: That's helpful to know, thank you for sharing that with me. Can you tell me more about not wanting to eat, is it because your tummy hurts or do you just not feel like eating, and have you thrown up at all recently?

speaker: Patient
text: My tummy doesn't hurt, I just don't wanna eat. Mommy says I'm being picky, but I don't feel like eating my favorite foods, and that's weird. I haven't thrown up or anything, I just don't feel like eating, and sometimes I feel tired.

speaker: Doctor
text: That must be very concerning for your mom. Have you had any recent travels or exposures to anyone who is sick, and can you tell me more about what you mean by feeling tired, is it all the time or just when you're playing? REQUEST TEST: Complete Blood Count.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: WBC: 11,000 /μL, Hemoglobin: 12 g/dL, Platelets: 300,000 /μL

speaker: Doctor
text: Thank you for sharing that information with me. Can you tell me more about your family medical history, does anyone in your family have any heart problems or liver issues? And I see the results of your blood test are here, your white blood cell count is slightly elevated, which could indicate some kind of infection or inflammation. REQUEST TEST: Liver Enzyme Panel.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: ALT: 45 U/L, AST: 47 U/L, Albumin: 4.0 g/dL, Total_Bilirubin: 0.8 mg/dL

speaker: Doctor
text: Your liver enzyme panel shows some elevated levels of ALT and AST, which could indicate that your liver is not functioning properly. Can you tell me if you've had any abdominal pain or discomfort, especially in the right upper quadrant where your liver is located? REQUEST TEST: Abdominal Ultrasound.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Liver palpable 1.5 times the normal size for age, no splenomegaly, mild distension, and shifting dullness absent.

speaker: Doctor
text: Thank you for sharing that information with me. Can you tell me if you've had any episodes of abdominal swelling or tenderness, especially after eating or drinking, and have you noticed any changes in the color of your urine or stool? REQUEST TEST: Urinalysis.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: So your urinalysis came back with normal readings, that's helpful to know. Can you tell me if you've experienced any fatigue or weakness in your muscles, especially after playing or running around, and have you had any recent weight gain or loss? REQUEST TEST: Echocardiogram.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Presence of an atrial septal defect with left to right shunt.

speaker: Doctor
text: So the echocardiogram shows that you have a heart defect, an atrial septal defect, which could be contributing to your rapid breathing and fatigue. Can you tell me if you've ever had any episodes of blue discoloration of your skin or lips, especially when you're crying or exerting yourself? REQUEST TEST: Chest X-Ray.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Enlarged cardiac silhouette, no pulmonary edema.

speaker: Doctor
text: So the chest x-ray shows an enlarged cardiac silhouette, which is consistent with the atrial septal defect found on the echocardiogram. Can you tell me if you've ever had any episodes of dizziness or lightheadedness, especially when standing up quickly or changing positions? REQUEST TEST: Electrocardiogram.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: So the electrocardiogram came back with normal readings, that's helpful to know. Can you tell me if you've ever had any episodes of chest pain or discomfort, especially when you're playing or exerting yourself, and have you noticed any changes in your breathing patterns when you're lying down versus sitting up? REQUEST TEST: Cardiac MRI.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: So the cardiac MRI came back with normal readings, that's helpful to know. Can you tell me if you've noticed any changes in your energy levels or ability to play and run around like you used to, and have you had any recent illnesses or infections that may have triggered these symptoms? REQUEST TEST: Hepatitis Panel.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: So the hepatitis panel came back with normal readings, which helps to rule out some potential causes of your liver enlargement. Can you tell me if you've noticed any changes in your appetite or eating habits over the past few weeks, and have you had any exposure to toxins or certain medications that could be affecting your liver? REQUEST TEST: Liver Biopsy.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: So the liver biopsy came back with normal readings, which is a bit surprising given the enlargement of your liver. Can you tell me if you've noticed any changes in your skin, such as jaundice or easy bruising, and have you had any swelling in your arms or hands in addition to your legs? REQUEST TEST: Coagulation Panel.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: So the coagulation panel came back with normal readings, that's helpful to know. Can you tell me if you've noticed any changes in your overall mood or behavior, such as feeling more irritable or anxious, and have you had any difficulty concentrating or paying attention? REQUEST TEST: Blood Culture.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: So the blood culture came back with normal readings, which helps to rule out a bacterial infection. Can you tell me if you've had any recent vaccinations or medications that may be contributing to your symptoms, and have you noticed any changes in your sleep patterns or difficulty breathing at night? REQUEST TEST: Sleep Study.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: So the sleep study came back with normal readings, that's helpful to know. Can you tell me if you've noticed any changes in your overall activity level or ability to play and have fun like you used to, and are there any other symptoms that you're experiencing that we haven't talked about yet? REQUEST TEST: Thyroid Function Panel.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: So the thyroid function panel came back with normal readings, which helps to rule out any thyroid-related issues. Can you tell me if you've noticed any changes in your growth or development, such as a decrease in height or weight gain, and have you had any other symptoms like hair loss or skin rashes? REQUEST TEST: Congenital Disorder Panel.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: So the congenital disorder panel came back with normal readings, that's helpful to know. Can you tell me if you've noticed any other symptoms or changes in your body that we haven't discussed yet, and do you have any other questions or concerns about what might be causing your rapid breathing and liver enlargement? REQUEST TEST: Lymph Node Biopsy.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS

speaker: Doctor
text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Atrial Septal Defect (ASD) with potential complications of Congestive Heart Failure, rather than Cholecystitis. The consensus among the doctors points towards the cardiac anomaly as the primary issue, with the liver enlargement likely being secondary to congestive heart failure due to the ASD. The discussion does not strongly support Cholecystitis as the final diagnosis, given the normal liver biopsy and other liver function tests.
